title: There Are More Ways to Trade Stocks for Free. But There’s a Catch.
text:
A price war may soon break out in stock-trading commissions.

Interactive Brokers (ticker: IBKR) announced last week that it’s rolling out a new “lite” version of its trading platform with free, unlimited trading for U.S. equities. The service will launch in October, the firm said, with relatively low rates on margin borrowing and a yield of 1.5% below the Fed Funds rate on cash reserves (higher than most other brokers). Interactive’s regular platform is now called “IBKR Pro” and clients can switch between the two a few times...
description: Brokers may charge high margin rates, or offer low yields on cash reserves. They may impose additional account fees or charge steep rates to trade options or other products.
